abstract.p: IBM and Diveo Broadband Networks, Internet infrastructure provider, agree on five-year pact to offer Web hosting services in Latin America; companies say deal is worth $120 million; IBM contracts for Web-hosting centers in Buenos Aires, Sao Paulo and Mexico City; in turn, Diveo hires IBM Global Services to manage operations of data centers (S)

block.p: I.B.M. and Diveo Broadband Networks, an Internet infrastructure provider, agreed on a five-year pact to offer Web hosting services in Latin America. As part of the deal, which the companies said was worth $120 million, I.B.M. contracted for Web-hosting space and bandwidth in Diveo's Internet data centers in Buenos Aires, Sao Paulo and Mexico City. In turn, Diveo hired I.B.M. Global Services to manage the operations of the data centers. The companies plan to offer comprehensive Web-hosting services in Argentina, Brazil and Mexico, Latin America's three largest Internet markets.
